qas.question: Whos educatgion approach was introduced in Germany in the 19th century and is used in most Kindergartens?

Who were the founders of progressive education?

plausible_answers.text: Amos Bronson Alcott, Ralph Waldo Emerson, and Henry David Thoreau

qas.question: Who is not an American transcendentalist?
Who was the founder of non-progressive education?

context: In time, some ideas from these experiments and paradigm challenges may be adopted as the norm in education, just as <a0_0>Friedrich Fröbel's<a0_0/> approach to <b3_0>early childhood education<b3_0/> in <b4_0><b5_0>19th-century<b5_0/><b4_0/> Germany has been incorporated into contemporary kindergarten classrooms. Other influential writers and thinkers have included the Swiss humanitarian <a1_0>Johann Heinrich Pestalozzi<a1_0/>; the American transcendentalists <b6_0>Amos Bronson Alcott, Ralph Waldo Emerson, and Henry David Thoreau<b6_0/>; the founders of progressive education, <a2_0><b7_0>John Dewey and Francis Parker<b7_0/><a2_0/>; and educational pioneers such as Maria Montessori and Rudolf Steiner, and more recently John Caldwell Holt, Paul Goodman, Frederick Mayer, George Dennison and Ivan Illich.
